Q:

Laser scan topic returns many messages

I am using a very simple subscription to a /scan topic to get the laser distances that my hokuyo laser scanner has grabbed, using:
scan_msg = rospy.Subscriber("/scan", LaserScan, scan_message, queue_size=1)

but when I print out the returning message I get 3 message packets, not 1 as expected. Why?
Code:
rospy.init_node("node1")
def scan_message(msg):
        laser_range = msg.ranges
        print "Range: ",laser_range
    
    
 scan_msg = rospy.Subscriber("/scan", LaserScan, scan_message, queue_size=1)

inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf, inf)

Originally posted by John999991 on ROS Answers with karma: 37 on 2020-03-15
Post score: 0

A:

Please look over ROS tutorials (http://wiki.ros.org/rospy/Overview/Publishers%20and%20Subscribers).
A subscriber object is not a message, its declaring a subscription to a topic with some parameters. The callback is what will process incoming messages. So in your example the scan_msg is actually a subscriber object and the scan_message is a callback function signature.

Originally posted by stevemacenski with karma: 8272 on 2020-03-16
This answer was ACCEPTED on the original site
Post score: 1

Original comments
Comment by John999991 on 2020-03-16:
I have implemented the callback function from where I print out the message I receive. The problem is that I get 3 messages instead of 1.
Comment by pcoenen on 2020-03-16:
Please show that code and the output as well.
Comment by John999991 on 2020-03-16:
I have added the important portion of my code on the original question.
Thank you.
Comment by nickw on 2020-03-16:
Not sure what you mean by three message packets - what is leading you to say that is what is happening.
Comment by pcoenen on 2020-03-16:
Is any code missing? I don't understand where the I heard is coming from.
Comment by John999991 on 2020-03-16:
Sorry, I fixed it.
Comment by John999991 on 2020-03-16:
I get 3 times the Range: {values},  so I suppose I get the Sub to run 3 times...No?
Comment by nickw on 2020-03-16:
I am assuming the laser scanner sends messages one after the other - is this just displaying multiple messages that have arrived, each one a separate call when a message is received. In the absence of other code it is impossible to say ?
The values are slightly different, so it is not the same thing that is being printed 3 times
Comment by gvdhoorn on 2020-03-16:\

so it is not the same thing that is being printed 3 times

exactly.
@John999991: your callback gets invoked 3 times, with 3 different messages.
"Subs" don't "run", only callbacks get invoked.
But perhaps it would be good to take a step back: what is it that you actually want to do? Why do you feel you  need to sample a single message from a topic to which messages are continuously being published?
Comment by John999991 on 2020-03-16:
The idea is to take the incoming message, break down the values into chunks, estimate some distances and take a decision on where the robot should move next.
I guess I can live with that since It would make no difference in my come.
I was curious on why the callback got invoked 3 times, that's all...
